parts.text:
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number.  This is not necessarily indicative of a violation, as CMF numbers are associated with candidates, and this post is from an organization, not a candidate.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name or implicitly endorse any candidate. It discusses the Romanian National Integrated Plan in the field of Energy and Climate Change (PNIESC), a general policy matter.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just specific individuals.  The reach estimate is ">1M", further supporting this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The objective of the post is to inform the public about the PNIESC. While energy policy is relevant to political platforms, the post itself does not advocate for or against any particular candidate or party in the parliamentary elections. There is no explicit or implicit call to vote for or against anyone.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post presents information in a factual manner, similar to a news report. It cites a source (https://energie.gov.ro/comisia-europeana-a-publicat-planul-national-integrat-in-domeniul-energiei-si-schimbarilor-climatice-pniesc-al-romaniei/) and focuses on policy details.  This aligns with journalistic standards of informing the public.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post does not express personal opinions; it presents factual information about a government policy.  There is no subjective interpretation or biased commentary.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1293619921766929</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post by "Romania Eficienta" discusses the Romanian National Integrated Plan in the field of Energy and Climate Change (PNIESC).  While energy policy is a topic relevant to political discourse, the post itself does not promote or oppose any specific candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections.  It presents factual information and cites a source, resembling a news report rather than electoral propaganda.  The lack of any explicit or implicit call to action related to voting further supports this conclusion.  The post's objective appears to be public information dissemination, not influencing electoral outcomes.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Romania Eficienta</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
